title: Patch Chat with the Playtest Team - Patch 7.11
body:
https://news-a.akamaihd.net/public/na_images/PCHCHT/Minions.jpg
Header by inkiness

Hey, everyone! I'm Riot King Cobra and it's time for another round of Patch Chat! These threads serve as opportunity for us to talk about the patches that come out every two weeks. You can find the most recent patch by following this link: [Patch 7.11 Notes](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/patch/patch-711-notes).

I'm on Riot's Playtest Team, a group of high elo players who play with the new champions, reworks, balance tweaks, items, and map updates before they are released. It's our job to the test the changes that our designers come up with and ensure that we're introducing positive changes to League in terms of both balance and fun. Ask us questions - we'll try to answer as many as we can!

In Patch 7.11, we've introduced updates to Rek'Sai, Kindred, and Malzahar! We also used this patch as an opportunity to follow up on midseason with changes to some struggling tanks and Maokai and Zac. Beyond this, we also are toning down some champions like Ahri, Caitlyn, Lucian, Syndra, and Yasuo. There's other changes as well, be sure to read the patch notes! :)

All of us on the Playtest Team are avid gamers so feel free to talk to us as fellow LoL players!

replies.body: I've seen a good amount of clips of Rek'Sai's ultimate ability missing. Is that intended to be a dodgeable ability?

Yes, I think you need a decently well-timed dash or flash. Maybe you can run out of it if you're super super fast?

EDIT: looks like I was wrong about this, sorry guys. The spell functions similarly to Fizz Q in terms of dealing damage. We're looking to increase the hitbox next patch. What we're discussing now is a range where will still be able to flash out of it or run out with a movespeed buff like Zilean W but you can't walk out.

Nah , you can just walk forwards and it'll miss every time. 

https://media.giphy.com/media/3KeDVHzcqk0WQ/giphy.gif

Logged in just to post this link. One big problem here is the fact that's it's point and click but it can miss. If someone can just dash/walk out of the way I should be able to aim my ult at them. Basically if I cast my ult on someone I have no idea if it'll hit them or not, I have no agency in where I end up after I press R.

Yeah that looks like there's way too much counterplay there, I'll follow up today for an update

EDIT: we're looking to increase the Ult hitbox next patch. What we're discussing now is a range where will still be able to flash out of it or run out with a movespeed buff like Zilean W but you can't walk out.

Ok not trying to be mean here but thats just dumb, i mean if you guys made WW ult work like that he would be absolute trash.

This breaks a cardinal rule of point and clicks which is if you can click you will hit unless they are fizz or have zhonya, but more importantly it probably feels like crap to use, i have not tried her yet but i rather assume the feeling is like ulting with WW having your models claws fly though an enemy yet not trigger because its annie, teemo or other mid sized champion.

In short to me this ability seems like a trap skill, where it seems like a good idea to use but ends up just royally screwing you over because they side stepped a point and click targetted ability, honestly i'd only imagine the rage you guys would receive if you could side step annies Q, Leesin W as an ally, rakan shield. ect ect.
Why? Should point and click abilities, especially ults be dodgable? Why not make it a skill shot?
I don't think a skillshot can work with the mark limitation that Rek'sai has.

thoughts on doran shield on adc or doran shield in general
it's OP, but not by too much.

Do you think an appropriate way to hit it would be making the +5 damage VS creeps melee only so there's an actual tradeoff for ADCs who want a defensive route? I've generally not seen this item as super problematic on melees, it's mostly just ADCs getting a free lane with it.

nah, I think that's too hamfisted. I think it's fine on ADCs as long as you only buy it in cases where you're expecting to be bullied like vs Caitlyn or something. When Caitlyn buys it versus other ADs, that seems problematic to me because she should be the one in charge of aggression in most scenarios, and that's what showed up in LCK.
In how many games? Are you seriously planning on nerfing it because pro players are experimenting? What's next, Sona nerfs after all the two games she showed up in MSI?
It was bought every single game in LCK by every single ADC in the first week I believe, which was 16/16 games. They weren't experimenting, it was clearly optimal.
The only problem is for champs like Gnar who would lose the benefit of the passive for a toplaner.
That's a fairly easy fix. +5 AD, or maybe 3 to reduce the effect the buff would have on enemy champs.
Giving I ad has no purpose for the item.  It's a tank item first, adding damage would be a mute point.
Do you think that with the current rework to Kindred she will be played more frequently on bot rather than jg?
Nope, don't think her range is long enough and her ability to trade poke is pretty poor.

Hi! I love Rakan, and I've been doing pretty well on him since his release. However, he doesn't seem to be having much success in solo queue: his win rate has been significantly below-average, even as his play rate tanks. Some related questions:

1. How do you feel about Rakan's laning right now? Personally, playing him into a ranged bully like Sona borders on impossible, since Rakan has neither range nor durability. 
2. Is it okay that none of the support starting items are perfect fits for him? At least Thresh gets the auto attack damage bonus for last-hitting with Relic Shield. 
3. He seems to be one of the weakest supports in the game early (perhaps the weakest), and one of the strongest late (perhaps the strongest). Is this an intentional part of his identity, or something that will be addressed later?
4. Did the shift in power from his E into his W and Q have the intended effect?

Thank you!

Personally:

I think Rakan having a weak lane is completely OK, but he might be slightly too weak. Similar to Taric, if this character had a strong lane I don't think we'd ever play against anything else (remember his OP release?) and that it's an interesting decision to take a risk for his late game.

> [{quoted}](name=penguin,realm=NA,application-id=A7LBtoKc,discussion-id=I2e9uooR,comment-id=00190000,timestamp=2017-06-02T00:07:58.547+0000)

Speaking of Taric, how does the team feel about him at the moment? He hasn't had a pass on changes in what feels like a long time. Is he forgotten? I love playing him as my main, but I worry he's just completely disappeared since his rework.

I think Taric is a really good example of how an atypical power curve functions well in LoL. He has noticable drawbacks when you pick him (weak lane), but scales phenomenally into the late game when played well, and has a strong strategic niche as the "teamfight support guy". I'd be really disappointed if we buffed him because I think he's in a great spot in terms of balance as I think it would result in him just being overplayed & I personally think LoL is a more interesting game when differing characters spike dramatically at different times in the game.

Ok, my question about Malzahar (as somebody who doesn't just suffer him but plays him aswell):

Why all the messing around with poor voidlings and still no proper rework of his ult?

I mean, imho, voidlings were fine even before the nerf. Sure, they are annoying but situational and counterable and requires a bit of brainwork from both Malz and the opposition. Just like Heimer's turrets, Zyra's plants, tracking Ori's ball, etc. They are fine.
But Malz's R is a simple point and click "delete enemy champ" ability. Sure, it forces them to buy QSS but even then it's very bland tbh. (I know there are other very similar abilities all around the champ pool, I find them bad design aswell...)
The change from %hp to flat damage doesn't change the core of the problem.

So, I don't really get you guys about this...

We don't make that kind of decision (That'd be up to champion update/champion teams) but honestly his point&click ultimate is pretty iconic for the champion. I don't think it causes any balance options outside of the support role. Rooting yourself to melt someone is a risk if you are carrying a large portion of your team's gold.

Have you guys tried rek'sai top, is she better there or is the intended lane still jungle? 
Also have you guys encountered the bug where rek'sai ult misses, seen a couple of videos with it, is like I am watching ww ulting and barely missing.
We think Rek'sai is better in Jungle. A large chunk of her power comes from tunnels and Tremor Sense, both of which aren't nearly as useful in top lane

We pretty recently changed Fizz which dropped his top lane a lot (Bruiser fizz) and also lowered the mid power (much less than top) so I think we'd probably give it a couple more patches to see if those have an affect before making anymore changes.
